channel.title: MoneySkillTalk Blog
channel.description: Learn how to make the most of your money skill here.

item.title: 8 prompts that will change your business
item.description: 8 prompts that will change your business
item.content:encoded:
8 prompts that will change your business

AI ChatBot can automate your entire business.

But only if you use the right prompts.

Here are 8 prompts that will change everything 👇👇👇

=========

1/ Business Model Validation

Prompt:

“Act as a startup advisor & evaluate my business idea: {briefly describe your idea}. Analyze market potential, customer demand & key risks. Provide a score (1-10) w/ reasoning, suggest improvements & a go-to-market strategy. Prioritize realistic, data-backed insights.”

2/ AI Sales Strategy

Prompt:

“Help optimize my sales strategy for {industry/business type}. Provide a tailored approach using AI-driven lead generation, customer segmentation & automated follow-ups. Suggest specific tools, outreach methods & A/B test ideas to improve conversion rates.”

3/ Productivity Hacks for Entrepreneurs

Prompt:

“As an AI efficiency coach, recommend 10 productivity hacks specifically for entrepreneurs in {industry}. Include AI automation tools, workflow improvements & delegation strategies. Rank them by impact & effort level for easy implementation.”

4/ Investor Pitch Refinement

Prompt:

“Review my startup pitch: {insert key pitch points}. Improve clarity, impact & persuasion. Provide a revised version w/ a strong hook, data-backed validation & compelling call-to-action. Suggest ways to make it more investor-friendly & engaging.”

5/ AI Content Marketing

Prompt:

“Develop a content marketing strategy for {business type}. Outline a 3-month plan w/ blog topics, social media posts & email campaigns. Suggest AI tools for content creation, SEO optimization & audience engagement. Prioritize growth-driven tactics.”

6/ Automating Business Operations

Prompt:

“Suggest automation tools for {specific business process} in my {industry}. Identify AI-driven solutions for efficiency, cost reduction & scalability. Provide implementation steps & potential challenges. Prioritize low-cost & high-impact options.”

7/ Competitive Analysis for Startups

Prompt:

“Act as a market analyst & compare my startup {business name} vs. {top competitors}. Identify strengths, weaknesses & unique selling points. Provide a SWOT analysis & strategies to differentiate in the market. Suggest AI tools for ongoing competitive research.”

8/ AI Decision Making

Prompt:

“Help me make a data-driven decision: {describe your dilemma}. Analyze risks, benefits & provide a logical framework to evaluate options. Suggest AI-powered analytics tools to enhance decision-making in {specific business area}.”

item.title: When Heaven is about to entrust someone with a great mission ...
item.description: When Heaven is about to entrust someone with a great mission ...
item.content:encoded:
天將降大任於斯人也，
必先苦其心志，
勞其筋骨，
餓其體膚，
空乏其身，
行拂亂其所爲，
所以動心忍性，
曾益其所不能。

When Heaven is about to entrust someone with a great mission,
it first tests their mind and will with hardship,
wearies their muscles and bones,
exposes them to hunger,
plunges them into poverty,
and throws obstacles in their path.
This is to shake their hearts, build their endurance,
and ultimately strengthen them to accomplish what they could not before.

- Source: Mencius, “Gaozi II”

item.title: What do wealthy people want?
item.content:encoded:
What do wealthy people want?

1. What are wealthy people lacking?

Wealthy individuals often experience emotional, time-related, and trust-related deficiencies rather than financial ones:

  • Lack of time: They highly value services or solutions that can “buy” them time.
  • Lack of personalized attention: They are drawn to bespoke services that truly understand them.
  • Lack of trustworthy partners or talent: They seek partners who guarantee privacy and high-quality outcomes.
  • Lack of authenticity: They crave genuine relationships, experiences, and content—free from pretense.
  • Boredom: They have little interest in the ordinary and seek surprise and exceptional experiences.

2. What do they want?

  • Premium experiences: Luxurious, personalized lifestyle services (e.g., private travel, 1:1 health and mental coaching)
  • Exclusivity: Unique, exclusive experiences, products, and knowledge
  • Time-saving + trust: Experts or systems that solve problems “on their behalf”
  • Education for children/successors: Elite education, global exposure, strong personal networks
  • Spiritual fulfillment/self-actualization: Life beyond money—impact, values, and purpose

3. Where can you find them?

Offline:

  • Global forums, charity events, golf courses, yacht clubs, luxury art fairs
  • Premium schools, international school parent groups, global investment summits

Online:

  • Private investment communities, elite networking platforms (e.g., Tiger 21, EO, YPO)
  • Private social media groups, exclusive forums for high-net-worth individuals
  • Luxury brand VIP programs, executive/investor groups on LinkedIn

4. How to approach them?

Strategic approach:

  • Define the problem first: Identify problems they “can’t solve with money”
  • Position yourself as a qualified partner: Use premium branding and a strong personal image
  • Referral-based approach: Introductions work better than direct marketing
  • Build trust through performance: Showcase your results, case studies, and testimonials
  • Highlight scarcity and exclusivity: “Limited intake,” “private consulting,” “VIP only”

Example:

“Build a ‘Private AI Assistant’ service that wealthy founders can trust and rely on.”

  • Problem: Information overload and time scarcity
  • Solution: Personalized summaries, research, and schedule management
  • Approach: Get introduced through VC partners; demo at premium tech forums

item.title: Solve rich people’s problems
item.content:encoded:
Solve rich people’s problems

  1. The easiest way to make more money is to solve expensive problems for people who can afford to pay them.

  2. Dear younger me: The less a customer pays, the more problems they cause.

  3. To make more money: You don’t need to solve more problems, you need to pick better people to solve them for.

  4. The fastest way to make more money is take what you’re already good at, and do it for people who have more money. Rich people pay more for the same stuff.

  5. Either solve the problems of a few rich people or a lot of poor people. But don’t get stuck in between trying to sell average products at average prices to average people.

The average is where businesses bleed and ambition goes to die.

item.title: The Power of Inversion Thinking
item.content:encoded:
The Power of Inversion Thinking

Elon Musk is a big believer in Inversion Thinking.

Not just Musk, Albert Einstein, Charlie Munger, and Marcus Aurelius used it too.

What is inversion thinking?

A problem-solving technique where you tackle problems backward.

Instead of focusing on success, you identify what leads to failure and avoid those actions.

This leads to a faster & easier decision-making process.

Here’s how to use it to solve problems and become a better version of you 👇

1. The Stoics had an exercise called “premeditatio malorum” that applied this model

The goal was to envision the negative things that could happen.

They believed that by imagining the worst-case scenario…

They could make better plans to prevent them.

2. Elon Musk is a big advocate of inversion thinking

He often uses it to avoid pitfalls in his ventures.

He identifies potential failures early & steers his projects away from common mistakes.

3. It’s also a tool Charlie Munger regularly uses.

“Avoiding stupidity is easier than seeking brilliance,” - he believes.

Rather than trying to win, avoid losing.

4. Why is inversion thinking so powerful?

As humans, we’re better at seeing threats than seeing opportunities.

By inverting your thinking, you turn complex problems into obvious solutions.

Another benefit of inversion thinking is its ability to relieve anxiety.

When facing a difficult problem, it’s hard to see the way out.

Inversion lets you see situations from a different angle.

Which allows you to come up with novel and creative solutions.

Take productivity for example.

Many people think they need a complex system or mental stimulants to work better.

But when you invert the question…

“How can I make sure I get nothing done today?”

The solution becomes simple: Leave your phone in another room.

Another example: Building a relationship.

What behaviors will ruin a relationship?

Judgment.
Lack of communication.
Not respecting the other person.

By inverting the question, you can easily see how to avoid a bad relationship.

Or in the context of a business…

What behaviors would ruin a business?

Having a bad product.
Not promoting your stuff.
Giving customers a poor experience.

It’s hard to see how to grow a business, easy to see how you can destroy one.

Here’s how you can apply Inversion Thinking in your life:

  1. Find the problem
  2. Identify the desired outcome
  3. Invert it by asking what would prevent that goal from happening
  4. Plan to avoid those actions

Inversion Thinking is a powerful tool of many great thinkers.

It’s counterintuitive.

It takes time & energy to tackle problems from a different viewpoint.

But when you master it, you’ll be able to see things you couldn’t see before.

item.title: How much do I think like a rich person?
item.description: How much do I think like a rich person?
item.content:encoded:
I asked a billionaire what separates the rich from the rest.

His answer?

“We play a game no one else knows exists.”

How much do I think like a rich person?

  1. The rich don’t work for money. They make money work for them.

  2. You trade hours for dollars. They trade dollars for assets.

  3. You chase income. They chase equity.

  4. You save to feel safe. They invest to get free.

  5. You see jobs as stability. They see them as a trap.

  6. You buy homes to live in. They buy homes to rent out.

  7. You fear debt. They weaponize it.

  8. You want comfort. They want control.

  9. You hope for retirement. They engineer it.

  10. You flaunt paychecks. They hide net worths.

  11. You ask “how much per hour?” They ask “how much equity?”

  12. You’re building a résumé. They’re building a company.

  13. You fear taxes. They study them.

  14. You pay full price. They negotiate everything.

  15. You scroll. They study.

  16. You chase trends. They buy infrastructure.

  17. You live for weekends. They own their time.

  18. You celebrate promotions. They celebrate distributions.

  19. You consume content. They create it.

  20. You look for sales. They look for scale.

  21. You save for vacations. They buy freedom.

  22. You lease liabilities. They build assets.

  23. You look rich. They are rich.

  24. You avoid risk. They manage it.

  25. You dream. They plan.

  26. You hope. They execute.

  27. You build habits of survival. They build systems for wealth.

  28. You work harder. They work smarter.

  29. You wait for approval. They buy access.

  30. You play not to lose. They play to win.

  31. You trust your employer. They trust contracts.

  32. You complain about bills. They automate income.

  33. You beg for time off. They take off whenever.

  34. You want rewards. They want returns.

  35. You invest after spending. They invest before spending.

  36. You buy now. They delay gratification.

  37. You count hours. They count leverage.

  38. You budget. They allocate.

  39. You trade effort. They trade equity.

  40. You sell your time. They sell outcomes.

  41. You spend on brands. They build them.

  42. You take pride in doing it alone. They build empires with teams.

  43. You ask for raises. They raise capital.

  44. You fear what others think. They fear being average.

  45. You want the spotlight. They want results.

  46. You blame the system. They study it.

  47. You seek luck. They build leverage.

  48. You chase approval. They chase scalability.

  49. You want praise. They want profit.

  50. You grind for today. They build for decades.

  51. You act rich. They think rich.

  52. You buy liabilities to feel good. They buy assets to never worry.

  53. You think money is scarce. They know money is printed daily.

  54. You look at prices. They look at returns.

item.title: "AI Art Challenge Contest 2025" hosted by the Ministry of Unification of the Republic of Korea
item.description: AI Art Challenge Contest 2025 hosted by the Ministry of Unification of the Republic of Korea
item.content:encoded:
AI Art Challenge Contest 2025 hosted by the Ministry of Unification of the Republic of Korea

Greetings.
We are pleased to announce the “AI Art Challenge Contest“ hosted by the Ministry of Unification of the Republic of Korea.

AI Art Challenge Contest (May 1, 2025 – May 31, 2025)

Express your dream of a unified Korea through an AI-generated four-panel comic!

This is a special opportunity to envision the future of a unified Korea using AI technology and your imagination.

Join the challenge now and creatively bring the dream of unification to life with AI.

◼︎ Theme : Create a four-panel comic using generative AI, choosing one of the following topics:

  • Imagining a future where reunification is the only path to meeting separated families
  • Imagining a future where reunification is the only path to new experiences

◼︎ Eligibility :

  • Anyone interested in a unified Korea — including Korean citizens and overseas Koreans

◼︎ Schedule :

  • Submission Period: May 1 (Thu) – May 31 (Sat), 2025 (until midnight)
  • Jury Evaluation: June 4 (Wed), 2025
  • First Public Voting (Japan): June 29 (Sun), 2025
  • Second Public Voting (TBD): Between September–October 2025
  • Award Ceremony: November 7 (Fri), 2025

◼︎ Awards :

  • Grand Prize (1 winner): KRW 500,000
  • Creative Prize (1 winner): KRW 200,000
  • Harmony Prize (3 winners): KRW 100,000 each

◼︎ How to Apply :

  • Submit the application via the official challenge website.

◼︎ Contact :

  • Art Challenge Operations Team: 2025auac@gmail.com

※ This contest is held in collaboration with the “Overseas Korean Unification Cultural Events” by the Office of International Cooperation.

item.title: How to Check and Download Your KakaoPay QR Code (for Receiving)
item.description: MoneySkillTalk introduces how to check and download your KakaoPay receiving QR code
item.content:encoded:
MoneySkillTalk introduces how to check and download your KakaoPay receiving QR code.

First, open the KakaoTalk mobile app, then go to the “More” menu and tap the “Scan” button at the top.

When the “Scan” screen appears, tap the “Receive” option at the bottom.

Once you tap “Receive,” your personal KakaoPay receiving QR code will be displayed.

Entering an amount is optional. If you enter an amount, a QR code with a fixed amount will be generated. If you leave it blank, a QR code allowing the sender to freely enter the amount will be automatically created.

To download the QR code image, tap the download icon below the code.

The KakaoPay Mobile Transfer Link Generator is an online service that allows you to easily generate a mobile transfer link using the downloaded QR code (for receiving).

By placing the generated link on your website or blog, customers can send payments to your KakaoPay account with a single click—no extra steps required.

KakaoPay Mobile Transfer Link Generator : Learn More
www.mkttalk.com/tools/kakaopay-link-generator/

If you have any questions about the service, feel free to contact us anytime via KakaoTalk!

WordPress Website Showcase

If you’re planning to create a new website, homepage, online store, or community using WordPress—or looking to redesign your existing site — the first step is usually to seek inspiration or reference other sites.

But finding well-made WordPress websites can be tricky if you don’t know where to look.

That’s why MoneySkillTalk has curated and organized top WordPress website examples from around the world — USA, Europe, China, Japan, Korea, and more. (Continuously updated)

  • WordPress Sites Random Viewer - Instantly view random WordPress site examples worldwide

  • WordPress Analytics - A tool for analyzing hidden data such as themes, hosting, plugins, developers, and domains
